meanings.definition: The act or placement of two things (usually abstract concepts) near each other.
meanings.sent1: The juxtapositions of light and dark in the painting create a striking contrast.
meanings.sent2: The artist used clever juxtapositions of colors to make the artwork more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositions of sweet and sour flavors in the dish made it surprisingly delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her poem was a beautiful juxtapositions of joy and sorrow, capturing the complexities of life.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositions of old and new architecture in the city showcase its rich history.

meanings.definition: The state of being close together or side by side.
meanings.sent1: The juxtapositions of the two buildings made them look like they were touching.
meanings.sent2: The juxtapositions of the chairs in the room created a cozy seating area.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositions of the two friends walking side by side was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent4: The juxtapositions of the mountains against the sky painted a breathtaking view.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositions of the houses along the street gave it a charming appeal.

meanings.definition: The comparison of two things to highlight their differences.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used juxtapositions to help the students understand the concept better.
meanings.sent2: The book's clever juxtapositions of the characters revealed their contrasting personalities.
meanings.sent3: The juxtapositions of the two movie genres made for an interesting film experience.
meanings.sent4: The juxtapositions of the two political ideologies sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The juxtapositions of the two paintings showcased the artist's unique style.
